summary: Completed frontend testing of navigation panel restructure into 4 domain-segmented sections (HR, SALES, CONSULTING, ADMIN) with role-based visibility. Fixed a bug in Reports.js where category filter wasn't updating on URL change. All features working correctly.
critical_code_review_comments: Navigation correctly structured into 4 sections: HR, SALES, CONSULTING, ADMIN
Role-based visibility working correctly: Admin sees all 4, Executive sees only SALES, Manager sees all 4
Sales flow branch (Leads → Pricing Plans → Quotations → Agreements) has visual connector with border-left and ChevronRight indicators
Sidebar sticky positioning (h-screen sticky top-0) and nav overflow-y-auto working correctly
Active states correctly apply bg-zinc-100 styling when on corresponding page
Fixed: Reports.js category filter now updates when URL params change via useEffect on searchParams
context_for_next_testing_agent: Navigation restructured into domain sections. Layout.js defines HR_ROLES, SALES_ROLES_NAV, CONSULTING_ROLES_NAV, ADMIN_ROLES arrays to control visibility. Reports page uses useSearchParams to read category from URL (?category=hr/sales/operations) and auto-sets filter. Email sending is MOCKED.

features_tested.Admin sees all 4 sections: PASSED - HR, SALES, CONSULTING, ADMIN all visible
features_tested.Executive sees ONLY SALES section: PASSED - Only SALES section visible, no HR/Consulting/Admin
features_tested.Manager sees all 4 sections: PASSED - HR, SALES, CONSULTING, ADMIN all visible
features_tested.Sales flow branch visual connector: PASSED - border-left-2 and ChevronRight indicators shown for Leads→Pricing→Quotations→Agreements
features_tested.Navigation active states: PASSED - bg-zinc-100 applied to active nav item
features_tested.User role in sidebar footer: PASSED - Role displayed under user name
features_tested.Sign Out button: PASSED - Logs out and redirects to login

Reports.js category filter bug.description: Category filter dropdown wasn't updating when navigating between different report links (HR Reports → Sales Reports)
Reports.js category filter bug.root_cause: filterCategory state was only initialized once on component mount, not reacting to URL param changes
Reports.js category filter bug.fix: Changed useState initializer to useEffect that watches searchParams changes and updates filterCategory accordingly

mocked_apis_list: Email sending - notifications queued in DB but not actually sent
